info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 5:14PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Garfield and northwestern Kane Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 513 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Hatch, or 30 miles north of Kanab, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bryce Canyon National Park, Tropic, Cannonville, Alton and Rubys Inn. This includes the following highways... US Route 89 between mile markers 105 and 108. Utah Route 12 between mile markers 7 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding.
